moves.7. f3 Bg7 8. Bc4 O-O 9. Qd2 a6: a6... this is sometimes called the Dragondorf.  Magnus Carlsen plays this kind of setup in the Dragon though I do not know the intricacies.
moves.10. h4: h4 getting on with whites attack
moves.10... Nxd4: I believe this is an old way to play the dragon now you would put the bishop on d7 and the rook on c8 first
moves.11. Bxd4 b5 12. Bb3 Bd7 13. Nd5 e5: e5?!  this move in only good in a dragon when the dark squared bishop has been traded off, now it's attacking potential is gone and white has an easy life.
moves.14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. Be3 Bxh4+: bxh4?!  Black voluntarily opens the h file for white.  White does not mind his king in the center because black has no attack.
moves.16. Ke2 Bf6 17. Bh6 Be6: Be6?  My dark squared bishop was not worth a rook
Qc4?!  It is necessary for black to keep the queen's on to keep it complicated
